type.name: section
type.title: Provisions to be observed by hucksters.
type.context: HUCKSTERS LICENSING AND CONTROL ACT under Provisions to be observed by hucksters. 6. (1) Every huckster shall keep his name, the number of his licence  and  the  words  licensed  huckster  visibly  and  legibly painted upon every box or other package and every vehicle used for the carriage of his goods.  (2) A huckster shall not permit to be used, or lend his licence to any person either for or without reward.  (3) No person not having in force a licence under this Act in his own real name shall use the words licensed huckster or any words importing that he  is a huckster or a licensed huckster or trades with or under the colour of a licence granted to any other person.  (4) Any person who contravenes any of the foregoing provisions of this section shall be guilty of an offence:  Provided that anyone in the bona fide employment of the owner of a licence may lawfully make use of, trade and act with and under that licence for the exclusive benefit of the owner, if the name of the person so employed is endorsed upon the licence by an officer or by a magistrate, in which last case the magistrate shall, within seven days thereafter, send or deliver to the officer the particulars of the endorsement.

type.name: section
type.title: Demand for production of huckster’s licence.
type.context: HUCKSTERS LICENSING AND CONTROL ACT under Demand for production of hucksters licence. 8. (1) Any officer may demand from any person huckstering or exposing for sale any goods, wares or merchandise his licence therefor, in any case in which a licence in respect thereof is or may be  required,  and  if  the  person  does  not  forthwith  produce  the licence the officer may seize and detain the goods, wares, and merchandise until the penalty of forfeiture incurred by the person huckstering or offering for sale the goods, wares or merchandise is paid together with all costs of removal.  (2) If the penalty or forfeiture is not paid upon conviction together with all costs of removal, the goods, wares and merchandise together with the motor vehicle, carriage or cart (together with the animal drawing it) or cycle as the case may be shall be liable and leviable for the amount thereof with costs and shall be sold by order of the convicting magistrate, and if the proceeds of the sale are not sufficient for the payment of the penalty or forfeiture with costs the party convicted shall be liable therefor and the payment shall be recovered by distress.

type.name: section
type.title: Assaulting officer in execution of duty.
type.context: HUCKSTERS LICENSING AND CONTROL ACT under Assaulting officer in execution of duty. 10. Any person who assaults, obstructs, hinders or molests an officer in the execution of his duty under this Act shall be guilty of an offence.
type.description: Any person who assaults, obstructs, hinders or molests an officer in the execution of his duty under this Act shall be guilty of an offence.

type.name: section
type.title: Acting without licence.
type.context: HUCKSTERS LICENSING AND CONTROL ACT under Acting without licence. 11. Any person who, in any part of Guyana, does any act for which a licence may not be granted for that part of Guyana though a licence is required elsewhere in Guyana shall be guilty of an offence and shall in addition to any other penalty be liable to a fine equal to the amount of the duty for a licence to do that act.

type.name: section
type.title: Sale of articles ordered to be sold under this Act.
type.context: HUCKSTERS LICENSING AND CONTROL ACT under Sale of articles ordered to be sold under this Act. 12. All articles ordered to be sold by virtue of any of the preceding  provisions  of  this  Act  shall  be  publicly sold  by  some police officer or constable, by direction of the magistrate, for cash to the highest bidder, and the magistrate shall cause notice of the intended sale to be affixed upon a board in his court room at least one week before the day of sale, unless the article seized is of a perishable nature in which case the same shall be sold at the time and in the manner directed by the magistrate;  and  the  surplus proceeds of every sale held under this section, after payment of any penalty awarded against the owner of the article sold, together with all costs and expenses, shall be paid to the owner if he is known, and if he is not known they shall accrue due and shall be paid by the magistrate to the Accountant General for the public use.
